children.name: text_content
children.label: Text Content
children.default:
Welcome to Australia

Australia is a land of dreams. From the sacred legends of the aboriginal Dreamtime, when the great spirits conjured the coral reefs, rainforests, and scorched red deserts, to armchair travelers who describe Australia as their dream destination, the Land Down Under deserves all the hype.

default.title: Welcome to Australia
default.text_content:
Welcome to Australia

Australia is a land of dreams. From the sacred legends of the aboriginal Dreamtime, when the great spirits conjured the coral reefs, rainforests, and scorched red deserts, to armchair travelers who describe Australia as their dream destination, the Land Down Under deserves all the hype.

children.name: text_content
children.label: Text Content
children.default:
AUSTRALIA LIFESTYLE

Depending on where you choose to live, Australia offers a unique lifestyle that attracts millions of visitors to its shores each year. Thanks to a combination of sunny weather, breathtaking natural landscapes and diverse cities, many Australians have adopted a laid-back, outdoorsy way of living that’s become a big drawcard for students visiting the country.

FOOD

Australians also enjoy a rich variety of food from around the world. You can find almost every international cuisine in restaurants, cafes, takeaway eateries and pubs across the country. Don’t forget to try traditional Aussie foods like Vegemite, kangaroo, ANZAC biscuits, Tim Tams and lamingtons during your stay, too.

children.name: text_2_content
children.label: Text 2 Content
children.default:
ARTS AND CULTURE

Australia has a thriving arts and culture scene. Most cities – and even smaller towns – are home to museums, art galleries, theatres, entertainment venues and creative spaces to suit all creative types.

TYPICAL LIVING COSTS

While in Australia you should make sure you have sufficient funds to cover your living expenses while you're studying. In addition to tuition fees, airfares and health coverage, living costs may include, but are not limited to: rent, food, groceries, transport, utilities, entertainment and clothing.

You can view some of the costs associated with living and studying in Australia here. (All costs are in Australian dollars)

default.text_2_content:
ARTS AND CULTURE

Australia has a thriving arts and culture scene. Most cities – and even smaller towns – are home to museums, art galleries, theatres, entertainment venues and creative spaces to suit all creative types.

TYPICAL LIVING COSTS

While in Australia you should make sure you have sufficient funds to cover your living expenses while you're studying. In addition to tuition fees, airfares and health coverage, living costs may include, but are not limited to: rent, food, groceries, transport, utilities, entertainment and clothing.

You can view some of the costs associated with living and studying in Australia here. (All costs are in Australian dollars)

children.name: text_content
children.label: Text Content
children.default:
HEALTH AND SAFETY

Australia is generally a very safe place to live and study, but it is important to look after yourself and always be aware of your surroundings. Be sure to look after your belongings, and avoid carrying large amounts of cash with you. Always use your common sense, whether at school, at home or outdoors.

HEALTH COVERAGE (OSHC)

Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) is a compulsory requirement for a student visa in Australia. ILSC can arrange the purchase of your OSHC through Bupa. Visit oshc.bupa.com.au for more information.

default.title: Health and Safety
default.text_content:
HEALTH AND SAFETY

Australia is generally a very safe place to live and study, but it is important to look after yourself and always be aware of your surroundings. Be sure to look after your belongings, and avoid carrying large amounts of cash with you. Always use your common sense, whether at school, at home or outdoors.

HEALTH COVERAGE (OSHC)

Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) is a compulsory requirement for a student visa in Australia. ILSC can arrange the purchase of your OSHC through Bupa. Visit oshc.bupa.com.au for more information.

children.name: text_content
children.label: Text Content
children.default:
WORK WHILE YOU STUDY

Most student visas in Australia allow you to work for up to 20 hours per week while your course is in session, and unrestricted hours during any scheduled course break. However, keep in mind finding a job may be difficult and you should not expect to cover your tuition fees or other expenses through part-time employment.

Visit studyinaustralia.gov.au/English/Live-in-Australia/work for more information.

default.title: Work

children.name: content_text
children.label: Content text
children.default:
Study Schedules

ILSC offers various schedule options so that you can tailor your learning to your personal needs. Students who choose the Full-Time Intensive schedules will experience the strongest immersion-learning experience and will usually notice that their language skills improve faster.

Core: Fundamental elective courses
Skills: Additional elective courses
1 lesson = 50 minutes

children.name: schedule_description_text
children.label: Schedule Description Text
children.default:
Part of the Medical English Diploma, the Certificate in Pharmacy, Examination Results, & Systems of the Body gives you a chance to explore medical English terminology and communication skills in the following areas:

  • Female reproductive system
  • Male reproductive system
  • Urinary system
  • Musculoskeletal
  • Giving examination results to patients
  • Pharmacy and pharmacist
  • The blood system
